2011.context: Zoom Video Communications, Inc. is a video communications platform company focused on video meetings, webinars, and collaboration tools. Founded by WebEx engineering team.

competitors.name: Cisco Webex
competitors.notes: One of the most well-known alternatives to Zoom, established player in corporate video conferencing with impressive boardroom and office credentials

competitors.name: Skype
competitors.notes: Go-to platform for personal video chat released in beta in 2003, one of the biggest Zoom competitors from day one

competitors.name: GoToMeeting
competitors.notes: Established video conferencing platform with screen sharing features and simple user experience

2015.context: Zoom Video Communications, Inc. is a video communications platform company focused on video meetings, webinars, and collaboration tools. Enterprise video meeting platform growing.

competitors.name: Cisco Webex
competitors.notes: Big name in corporate video conferencing with impressive boardroom and office credentials, one of the most well-known alternatives to Zoom

competitors.name: Skype
competitors.notes: Go-to platform for personal video chat since 2003 beta release, one of the biggest Zoom competitors from day one

competitors.name: GoToMeeting
competitors.notes: Used for both internal and external meetings with elegant screen sharing and drawing features, simple to use

competitors.name: Discord
competitors.notes: Launched in 2015, initially developed for gamers to interact and form communities, later expanded to various online communities

competitors.name: BlueJeans
competitors.notes: Conferencing platform with integrated audio and video fidelity, comprehensive security options, one-click join without account requirement

competitors.name: Google Meet
competitors.notes: Formerly Hangouts Meet, best-known video meeting platform available free for anyone with Google or Gmail account

competitors.name: Microsoft Teams
competitors.notes: All-in-one tool for video conferencing, team chat, phone calls, file sharing, and day-to-day work communications

competitors.name: IBM Sametime
competitors.notes: Provides real-time communication through instant messaging and audio/video conferencing, allows file sharing without limit

2020.context: Zoom Video Communications, Inc. is a video communications platform company focused on video meetings, webinars, and collaboration tools. COVID pandemic surge. Became verb for video calls.

competitors.name: Microsoft Teams
competitors.notes: Business communication platform part of Microsoft 365, enjoyed healthy growth spike throughout 2020, supports up to 300 members with guest access and shared files up to 10GB per team in free tier

competitors.name: Google Meet
competitors.notes: Made free to all users worldwide in May 2020 (previously paid service for educators) to compete with Zoom, supports up to 100 participants with 16 visible at a time, integrated with G Suite

competitors.name: Skype
competitors.notes: Microsoft's popular video chat platform, supports up to 50 participants for unlimited time for free, has call recording feature with recordings saved for up to a month

competitors.name: Cisco Webex
competitors.notes: Big name in corporate video conferencing with impressive boardroom credentials, dominated market before pandemic along with Polycom and Avaya, offers crystal-clear calls and instant messaging with collaboration tools

competitors.name: GoToMeeting
competitors.notes: Web conferencing service from LogMeIn with audio/video sessions, screen sharing, and mobile apps for Android and iOS, standard version allows up to 150 team members for $14/month or $12/month annually

competitors.name: Jitsi Meet
competitors.notes: Leading open source competitor developed by 8x8, utilizes WebRTC technology for encrypted video calls running directly in browser without downloads or plugins

competitors.name: Polycom
competitors.notes: Dominated video conferencing market before the pandemic alongside Cisco and Avaya

competitors.name: Avaya
competitors.notes: Dominated video conferencing market before the pandemic alongside Cisco and Polycom

2024.context: Zoom Video Communications, Inc. is a video communications platform company focused on video meetings, webinars, and collaboration tools. Post-pandemic normalization. AI Companion features.

competitors.name: Microsoft Teams
competitors.notes: Most notable competitor with 32.29% market share, comprehensive collaboration suite integrated with Office 365, bundled productivity solution for remote and hybrid organizations

competitors.name: Google Meet
competitors.notes: Significant competitor integrated with Google Workspace, 5.52% market share, offers 1-hour meetings for free users (vs Zoom's 40 minutes), leverages Google's cloud computing expertise

competitors.name: Cisco Webex
competitors.notes: Robust video conferencing solution with 7.61% market share, provides feature-rich collaboration tools including video meetings, webinars, and team messaging

competitors.name: GoToMeeting
competitors.notes: Closest alternative to Zoom for remote team collaborations with 8.81% market share, competitive advantage in unlimited cloud storage

competitors.name: RingCentral
competitors.notes: Cloud-based VoIP solution with 5.31% market share, features video and audio conferencing, desktop phone rentals, collaboration tools, and business application integrations

competitors.name: Slack
competitors.notes: Good alternative for smaller and more casual meetings, Slack huddles offer video chat capabilities with multi-user screen sharing and chat threads

competitors.name: Jitsi Meet
competitors.notes: Open-source video conferencing platform emphasizing simplicity and security, allows users to create and join meetings directly from web browser without accounts or downloads

competitors.name: Dialpad
competitors.notes: Cloud communications UCaaS platform providing integrated voice, video, and messaging capabilities from unified interface

competitors.name: FaceTime
competitors.notes: 2.16% market share

competitors.name: Skype
competitors.notes: 1.41% market share

competitors.name: Facebook Messenger
competitors.notes: 0.75% market share

competitors.name: BlueJeans
competitors.notes: 0.31% market share

2025.context: Zoom Video Communications, Inc. is a video communications platform company focused on video meetings, webinars, and collaboration tools. AI-powered collaboration. Competing with Microsoft Teams, Google.

competitors.name: Microsoft Teams
competitors.notes: Most significant competitor with over 320 million global users and approximately 32.29% market share. Used by 91% of Fortune 100 companies. Differentiates through seamless integration with Office applications and AI-powered features like automated meeting summaries.

competitors.name: Google Meet
competitors.notes: Integrated with Google Workspace with over 300 million monthly users. Strong presence especially in education sector. Benefits from tight integration with Gmail, Calendar, and other Google productivity tools.

competitors.name: Cisco Webex
competitors.notes: Long-standing enterprise solution maintaining strong foothold in government and large corporations, with market share ranging from 5% to 9.43%. Known for security and compliance features critical for regulated industries.

competitors.name: RingCentral
competitors.notes: Holds 5.31% market share and is a notable competitor in the UCaaS (Unified Communications as a Service) space. Offers integrated communication solutions combining video conferencing with phone systems and messaging.

competitors.name: GoTo Meeting (LogMeIn)
competitors.notes: Provides HD video communication for up to 250 participants with business chat messaging, unlimited cloud recording, and workflow integrations. Established player in the web conferencing market with enterprise features.

competitors.name: Dialpad Ai Meetings
competitors.notes: Offers AI-powered workflow automation and free plans. Leverages AI technology for transcription, real-time insights, and automated follow-ups, appealing to businesses seeking intelligent meeting solutions.

competitors.name: Slack (Salesforce)
competitors.notes: Offers huddles with video chat capabilities, multi-user screen sharing, and integrated chat threads for smaller, more casual meetings. Strong in team collaboration with video as a complementary feature.

competitors.name: TeamViewer
competitors.notes: Competitor offering remote access and meeting capabilities. Known for screen sharing and remote support functionality beyond just video conferencing, serving IT support and technical assistance use cases.
